Title: LNG Canada faces technical issues; more delays, diversions possible
Description: The 14 mtpa LNG Canada export plant in Kitimat has been experiencing technical issues with its start-up operations, as the noticed recent delays in loading operations at the facility.
Author: JS

Title: Worley receives full notice to proceed with works on CP2 LNG
Description: Australian engineering contractor Worley has received a Full Notice to Proceed from Venture Global under its reimbursable engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) contract for the Phase 1 of CP2 LNG export project facility located in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: LNG deliveries to China face delays amid typhoon and tsunami threats to eastern ports
Description: China’s eastern LNG terminals are bracing for potential disruption as twin natural hazards—Typhoon Co-May and a tsunami triggered by a major earthquake off Kamchatka today—threaten coastal areas, where a few of China’s LNG import terminals are located.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin, Japan, Taiwan LNG terminals on tsunami alert after major Kamchatka quake
Description: A powerful magnitude 8.8 earthquake struck off the east coast of Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula early Wednesday, triggering tsunami warnings for regions along the Pacific coast, including Russia Japan and Taiwan, leading to concerns over LNG supply disruptions with these  countries home to critical LNG export and import terminals.
Author: CK

Title: Knutsen takes delivery of second LNG carrier for QatarEnergy projects
Description: Norwegian shipping firm Knutsen Group has taken delivery of the 174,000 m3 LNG carrier Mesaieed from South Korea’s HD Hyundai,  the second in a series of ten vessels being built for long-term charter to QatarEnergy.
Author: CK
